name: barberry

[ C or U ] plural barberry or barberries a bush with orange or yellow flowers, small red fruits, and sharp points on the stems: The barberry, or Berberis, is often grown around houses as a burglar deterrent because of its pointed spines. Barberry bushes come in both deciduous and evergreen varieties.
[ C ] a small red fruit of the barberry bush: The fish was served in a sharp-tasting sauce of barberries. Add a few dried barberries to the dish to give it the distinctive sour taste.
More examplesFewer examplesThey had the unpleasant job of removing the large clumps of prickly barberry.A line of barberry bushes had been planted as a hedge.The berries of the barberry bush can be eaten but you'll need plenty of sugar to make them palatable.
